title: Altitudes
body:
We present a brief summary of the altitudes at which various points of this archipelago are situated above sea level. We hope to indicate other altitudes that are not mentioned here as the subject requires. We provide a note of the main highest points in ascending order, from the vicinity of the ocean to the highest eminence in Madeira, which is Pico Ruivo. This demonstrates the rugged terrain of the island, which has an area of less than 800 square kilometers, and the capricious relief offered by the topographical conditions throughout its entire length and width.
